name: Cracked Pot
description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken. Essential vessel for crafting cracked pot items. The materials and magics sealed within deploy their effects when  the pot is thrown.
usage: Container required for crafting cracked pot items. A maximum of 20 can be held.
location: See Cracked Pot for a full list of locations

name: Ritual Pot
description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken. Special item with greater durability than a cracked pot.  Essential vessel for crafting ritual pot items.  The materials and magics sealed within deploy their effects when the pot is thrown.
usage: Container required for crafting ritual pot items. A maximum of 10 can be held.
location: See Ritual Pot for a full list of locations

name: Perfume Bottle
description: Glass bottles used by perfumers. Used to seal various scent compounds. Essential vessel for crafting perfume items. The art of perfuming was once jealously guarded in the capital, but after the perfumers were drafted into service during the Shattering, the art became widely practiced throughout the Lands Between.
usage: Container required for crafting perfume items. A maximum of 10 can be held.
location: See Perfume Bottle for a full list of locations

name: Memory Stone
description: A black, lightly beguiling stone. Prized by the sorcerers who produce them. Increases memory slots. Said to be a fragment of the black moon that once hung above the Eternal City.
usage: Increases Memory Slots. A maximum of 8 can be held.
location: See Memory Stone for a full list of locations

name: Talisman Pouch
description: Small, withered bag, knitted by hand. Bestowed upon the ruling lord, or those attempting to become lord, by the elderly Finger Reader. Increases talisman equip slot. As the voices of the Two Fingers, Finger Readers are said to live lives eternal, and one is even supposed to have served as a wetnurse to royalty. or or omamori
usage: Increases Talisman equip slots. A maximum of 3 can be held.
location:
Upon defeating Margit, the Fell Omen in Stormhill [Map Link]or Morgott, the Omen King in Leyndell, Royal Capital[Map Link]
After speaking to Finger Reader Enia, after acquiring two Great Runes.or found in the Twin Maiden Husks' shop, if missed from Enia
Upon defeating Godfrey, First Elden Lord in Leyndell, Royal Capital[Map Link]

name: Heart of Bayle
description: The biatrial heart of Bayle the Dread. Dotted with horn-like gravel stones and glistening with deep-red liquor. Gorge upon this at the Grand Altar of Dragon Communion to absorb Bayle's power. The purest form of Communion, in the words of its priestess.
usage: Gain power of Bayle at the Grand Altar of Dragon Communion
location: Dropped by Bayle the Dread. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Larval Tear
description: An exceptionally rare creature that burgeons from spiritgraves and lives only a fleeting existence.Neither flesh nor spirit, but something in between. Material required by the amber egg cradled by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to birth people anew. Being born anew allows the reallocation of attributes boosted by leveling up. An exceptionally rare creature that burgeons from spiritgraves and lives only a fleeting existence. Neither flesh nor spirit, but something in between. Material required by the amber egg cradled by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to birth people anew. Being born anew allows the reallocation of attributes boosted by leveling up.
usage: Material needed by Rennala to grant rebirth
location: Prospect Town: Can be found on an area of illuminated graves. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]Can be found southeast of Scorched Ruins. It's possible that this can only be found at night as it's encompassed by glowing gravestones.  [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Well Depths Key
description: A crude, corroded key. Opens the iron grating at the bottom of the well in Belurat, the tower settlement.
usage: Opens the iron grating at the bottom of the well in Belurat
location: Belurat Tower Settlement: From the bridge, enter the room with two enemies and you will find the Well Depths Key there. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Gaol Upper Level Key
description: A frozen iron key. Opens the iron grating on the upper level of the Lamenter's Gaol.
usage: Opens the iron grating on the upper level of the Lamenter's Gaol
location: Can be found within Lamenter's Gaol. When you enter, proceed until you reach a fork in the path. Take the left turn, and after a short walk, enter the room on your right. Inside, you'll find a chest containing the Gaol Upper Level Key. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Gaol Lower Level Key
description: A frozen iron key. Opens the iron grating on the lower level of the Lamenter's Gaol.
usage: Opens the iron grating on the lower level of the Lamenter's Gaol
location: Can be found in the lower level of the Lamenter's Gaol. After using the Gaol Upper Level Key and descending the ladder, follow the path until you can climb a rocky ledge on your right. Take the left door, go ahead, jump down, and follow the wooden path. At the first entrance, take a left and continue straight. Climb down the rocks where you'll find a chest with the Gaol Lower Level Key inside. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Storeroom Key
description: A key with a spiral engraving. Opens the door to the storeroom on the second floor of Belurat, the tower settlement.
usage: Use to open the storeroom on the second floor of Belurat
location: Belurat Tower Settlement: From the top of the waterfall, you will find a room with a ladder, enter the room and climb the ladder. At the top, you will find a corpse with the Storeroom Key. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Stonesword Key
description: A sword-shaped stone key. Breaks the seal on imp statues, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item. Think well before using one.
usage: Use to break one imp statue seal
location: See Stonesword Key for a full list of locations

name: Keep Wall Key
description: Iron key with an engraved crest. Opens the wooden door beside the great gate on the shadow keep's west wall.
usage: Opens the wooden door on the west wall of the keep
location: Location goes here...

name: Prayer Room Key
description: Iron key with an engraved crest. Opens the door to the prayer room in the house of worship found in the church district of the shadow keep.
usage: Opens prayer room door in the house of worship found in the church district
location: Church of the Crusade: Acquired as a drop upon defeating the NPC Invader Fire Knight Queelign. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Igon's Furled Finger
description: Furled finger of Igon, the broken drake warrior. Gnarled and knotty, and deeply discolored on the inside. When facing Bayle the Dread, this summons Drake Warrior Igon from his sign. "My soul yet lies on the mountain."
usage: Summons Drake Warrior Igon from his sign
location: Will be given by Igon by interacting with him after defeating the Jagged Peak Drake in the area. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Black Syrup
description: An ebony-black syrup held in an unglazed jar. Moore asked that this be delivered to Thiollier. An unknown liquid apparently gathered and aged by the forager brood.
usage: Something Moore asked to be delivered to Thiollier
location: Talk to Moore outside Belurat, Tower Settlement to receive the Black Syrup item.  [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Messmer's Kindling
description: The kindling that burned inside Messmer the Impaler. A dark thing, eaten away at by a wicked serpent. Burns the sealing tree said to be found at the old Rauh ruins. Messmer, much like his younger sister, bore a vision of fire.
usage: Burns the sealing tree
location: Dropped by Messmer the Impaler. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Hole-Laden Necklace
description: A pale-blue necklace made from a thin, elongated stone hollowed out from the inside. Use at a hallowed ruin to sound a hanging bell. It was a teaching of Count Ymir. The fate of the one who sounds the hanging bell will be guided by the stars.
usage: Use at a hallowed ruin to sound a hanging bell
location: Cathedral of Manus Metyr: Given by Count Ymir when first interacted. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Imbued Sword Key
description: Stone key shaped like a sword.A special item, imbued with rich blue magic. Breaks the seal on the imp statues guarding the sending gates enshrined in each belfry, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item. Think well before using one.
usage: Unseals sending gate, but disappears upon use
location:
Castle Ensis: The Imbued Sword Key item can be found inside a treasure chest. The chest is located inside a tower's armor room. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]
The Four Belfries, Liurnia. Found in a chest at the topmost belfry[Map Link]
Raya Lucaria Academy, Liurnia Looted from a corpse found on the east side of the rooftops[Map Link]
Sellia, Town of Sorcery, Caelid Found in a barricaded, small building in the northeast section of town. Dispel the barrier by lighting the brazier atop the southwest tower[Map Link]
dlc: Base game & Shadow of the Erdtree DLC

name: Rusty Key
description: Rusted iron key. Opens a locked door in Stormveil Castle
usage: Opens a locked door in Stormveil Castle
location: Stormveil Castle, Limgrave Found in the dark room guarded by the Banished Knight[Map Link]

name: Drawing-Room Key
description: Key to Volcano Manor's drawing room. The door can be found in the westward corridor, upon the left hand side.
usage: Key to the Volcano Manor drawing room
location:
Volcano Manor, Mt Gelmir Received from Tanith after pledging your service to the Volcano Manor.[Map Link]
Alternatively, if Rykard is killed before pledging your services, Tanith will disappear from the Manor, the key will be left in her chair

name: Sewer-Gaol Key
description: Filthy key received from the Dung Eater. Unlocks sewer-gaol door said to lie beneath Leyndell, the Royal Capital.
usage: Unlocks sewer-gaol door beneath Leyndell.
location: Roundtable Hold Received from Dung Eater after acquiring at least one Seedbed Curse

name: Discarded Palace Key
description: A key discarded by Lunar Princess Ranni alongside her very flesh. Opens a treasure chest passed down to Carian Princesses. It is said to be found in the Grand Library of Raya Lucaria with her mother Rennala.
usage: Opens a treasure chest passed down to Carian Princesses.
location: Received from Miniature Ranni after defeating the Baleful Shadow

name: Academy Glintstone Key
description: Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Activates warp magic bound within the seals. A glintstone key will remember its user, meaning once used it can never be passed on to another. The academy does not welcome the indolent.
usage: Key to open the academy's two sealed gates
location:
West of the Academy, Liurnia Found on a sorcerer's corpse behind Glintstone Dragon Smarag[Map Link]
Raya Lucaria Academy, Liurnia Looted off a corpse hanging from the Church of the Cuckoo's chandelier. To reach the ceiling, you need to maneuver the rooftop section of the Academy[Map Link]

name: Sellian Sealbreaker
description: Glintstone key received from the sorceress Sellen. Capable of breaking the seal that keeps Master Lusat confined. Sellia, Town of Sorcerery can be found in Caelid. This key was said to have been found in the possession of a Sellian sorcerer.
usage: Can release Master Lusat from his confinement.
location: Obtained during Sorceress Sellen's questline. After finding Comet Azur on the body of Primeval Sorcerer Azur, speak with Sellen to further her quest. She will have an additional dialogue option, 'I have a favor to ask' that will give the player the Sellian Sealbreaker.

name: Carian Inverted Statue
description: Statuette of a scholar, with ground and sky inverted. Reveals the hidden form of the Carian Study Hall, which connects to the divine tower. To unveil the secret, affix it to the pedestal of the celestial globe.
usage: Key revealing the hidden form of Carian Study Hall.
location: Given by Ranni in Ranni's Rise after giving her the Fingerslayer Blade.[Map Link]

name: Dectus Medallion (Left)
description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Life of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia. The right half is said to reside in Fort Faroth in the Dragonbarrow, far to the east.
usage: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus.
location: Fort Haight, Limgrave Found atop the tower, accessible via ladder[Map Link]

name: Dectus Medallion (Right)
description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia. The left half is said to reside in the coastal Fort Haight to the far west.
usage: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus.
location: Fort Faroth, Caelid Found atop the eastern tower, accessible via ladder[Map Link]

name: Rold Medallion
description: Conjoined split medallion depicting the Flame Peak. Brandishing the medallion activates the Grand Lift of Rold, connecting Leyndell to the Mountaintops of the Giants. The forge of the flame of ruin is said to be found upon their peaks, and it is here Melina wishes to travel in resuming your journey together.
usage: Activates the Grand Lift of Rold, connecting Leyndell to the Mountaintops of the Giants.
location: Received from Melina after defeating Morgott, The Omen King[Map Link]

name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (Left)
description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
usage: Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path.
location: Castle Sol, Mountaintops of the Giants Found on the roof of the tower in the northeast, accessible after defeating Commander Niall[Map Link]

name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (Right)
description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
usage: Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path.
location: Village of the Albinaurics, Liurnia Received from Albus after unveiling his disguise. Found at the top of the hill, past the Depraved Perfumer[Map Link]

name: Chrysalids' Memento
description: Memento left by the chrysalids sacrificed for grafting. A brooch wrapped in red velvet. Traces of blood are visible. Faintly visible spirits try to convey something, but their voices cannot be heard.
usage: Broach wrapped in red velvet.
location: Found in Stormveil Castle, atop a pile of corpses in a room adjacent to a Grafted Scion mini-boss[Map Link]

name: The Stormhawk King
description: Ashes of a hawk revered by all others as sovereign back in the days when Stormveil's winds still raged like no other. This ancient monarch is proud however, refusing to answer anyone's summons.
usage: Ashes of a hawk which heeds no summons.
location: Chapel of Anticipation Upon returning to this location later in the game, head towards the roof of the southern wing of the chapel[Map Link]

name: Irina's Letter
description: Letter given by Irina, addressed to her father, the commander of Castle Morne. Gorgeous silken handkerchief, lightly stained with blood. Words can be made out within.
usage: Letter addressed to the commander of Castle Morne
location: Weeping Peninsula, Limgrave Received from Irina just near the Bridge of Sacrifice Site of Grace[Map Link]

name: Shabriri Grape
description: A yellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm. The surface is shriveled, and the inside is squishy, not unlike a large, overly-ripe grape. Give to the blind maiden to guide her to the distant light.
usage: Yellow, oozing eyeball of the infirm.
location:
One can be found near a spirit NPC at Godrick's throne room at Stormveil Castle, You do not have to defeat Godrick in order to obtain it, you can enter from the back by going around the castle using the broken bridge route.[Map Link]
Can be found on the lower level of the Purified Ruins. The entrance to this area is blocked by a large plank of wood that can be destroyed with rolls or attacks.[Map Link]
One is dropped by Edgar the Revenger, an NPC invader found at the Revenger's Shack in western Liurnia[Map Link]

name: Fingerprint Grape
description: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow. Seared with a repulsive fingerprint burn akin to those that marred his entire body. If offered to the blind maiden, it will lead her to the source of the distant light, allowing her to become a Finger Maiden.
usage: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow
location: Dropped by Festering Fingerprint Vyke[Map Link]

name: Rya's Necklace
description: Necklace stolen from Rya by the blackguard.  Features a relief of a dignified looking woman from a foreign country. It appears to hold great significance for Rya.
usage: Rya's necklace, stolen by a blackguard.
location: After speaking with Rya (Map Link]), you will get a quest to receive this stolen necklace. The necklace can be found at Blackguard Big Boggart's shack just a bit to the northwest. It can be bought for  1000 or by killing Blackguard.

name: Serpent's Amnion
description: Amnion from the mother's womb which cradled the poor unwanted offspring of a repellant birthing ritual. It will never dry out, remaining damp indefinitely.
usage: Amnion from a womb that bore unintended offspring.
location: Volcano Manor, Mt Gelmir Found on the altar after defeating the Godskin Noble[Map Link]

name: Tonic of Forgetfulness
description: Tonic in a small brass vial. Banishes distress and bitter memories.  A gift bestowed by Rykard, sworn to blasphemy, to Lady Tanith, who unfortunately had no use for it. "My Lord, there could be no greater distress than to forget you."
usage: Tonic that banishes distress and bitter memories.
location: Received from Tanith after giving the Serpent's Amnion to Rya and returning to the Volcano Manor

name: Dancer's Castanets
description: Castanets used by dancers from foreign lands. Received from Patches. The passionate dance comprises no seductiveness, but merely a dignified beauty.
usage: Castanets used by dancers from distant lands.
location: Given by Patches in Shaded Castle, before the boss room, after killing Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy and talking to him in Volcano Manor

name: Unalloyed Gold Needle
description: An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold. Once snapped in half, it has been repaired by Sage Gowry. A ritual implement crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods, it is thought capable of forestalling the incurable rotting sickness. "Now, all you need to do is deliver the needle to Millicent, convalescing in the church atop the cliff just beyond Sellia."  An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold.  Removed by Millicent from her flesh. Bears no trace of befouled blood, but is faintly moist with dew. "There is something I must return to Malenia. The dignity, the sense of self, that allowed her to resist the call of the scarlet rot."
usage: An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold.Removed by Millicent from her flesh. Bears no trace of befouled blood, but is faintly moist with dew.
location: Found upon Millicent's corpse after the end of her questline (if you sided with her)

name: Unalloyed Gold Needle
description: An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold. Once snapped in half, it has been repaired by Sage Gowry. A ritual implement crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods, it is thought capable of forestalling the incurable rotting sickness. "Now, all you need to do is deliver the needle to Millicent, convalescing in the church atop the cliff just beyond Sellia."  An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold.  Removed by Millicent from her flesh. Bears no trace of befouled blood, but is faintly moist with dew. "There is something I must return to Malenia. The dignity, the sense of self, that allowed her to resist the call of the scarlet rot."
usage: Snapped intricate needle of unalloyed gold.
location: Swamp of Aeonia, Caelid Dropped by Commander O’Neil[Map Link]

name: Unalloyed Gold Needle
description: An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold. Once snapped in half, it has been repaired by Sage Gowry. A ritual implement crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods, it is thought capable of forestalling the incurable rotting sickness. "Now, all you need to do is deliver the needle to Millicent, convalescing in the church atop the cliff just beyond Sellia."  An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold.  Removed by Millicent from her flesh. Bears no trace of befouled blood, but is faintly moist with dew. "There is something I must return to Malenia. The dignity, the sense of self, that allowed her to resist the call of the scarlet rot."
usage: An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold. Once snapped in half, it has been repaired by Sage Gowry.
location: Repaired by Sage Gowry after delivering him the original Unalloyed Gold Needle.

name: Valkyrie's Prosthesis
description: Golden prosthesis once used by the one-armed valkyrie. A masterwork of craftsmanship, with practice and skill it can be used as proficiently as a real arm. When Maleigh Marais, Lord of the Shaded Castle, embraced this prosthesis, he claimed to feel the presence of his personal goddess.
usage: Golden prosthesis used by the one-armed Valkyrie
location: Found in a chest in the room guarded by a single Cleanrot Knight on the North Western edge of The Shaded Castle.[Map Link]

name: Alexander's innards
description: A keepsake of the warrior jar Alexander. Found at the core of the dead flesh that once filled the great jar. The jars contain dregs inherited from those who came before. Thus are warriors passed from jar to jar, carrying dreams of greatness.
usage: A keepsake of the warrior jar Alexander. Found at the core of the dead flesh that once filled the great jar.
location: Crumbling Farum Azula After enough progress through Iron Fist Alexander's questline, he can be found past the crumbling tower where he will request a duel. Upon victory the player will receive this along with a Warrior Jar Shard and a Shard of Alexander.[Map Link]

name: Lord of Blood's Favor
description: Before soaking: Pure white oath-cloth given by Varré. The final trial to be anointed a Knight of Mohg, Lord of Blood. "Soak the cloth with a maiden's blood... The blood of anyone's maiden will do. You are maidenless, after all." After soaking: Fully reddened oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood. The final trial is complete. Luminary Mohg is sure to welcome you into his service, as a knight who will lay the foundations for his dynasty.
usage: Pure white oath-cloth given by Varré.
location: Reward for completing White Mask Varré's task

name: Lord of Blood's Favor
description: Before soaking: Pure white oath-cloth given by Varré. The final trial to be anointed a Knight of Mohg, Lord of Blood. "Soak the cloth with a maiden's blood... The blood of anyone's maiden will do. You are maidenless, after all." After soaking: Fully reddened oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood. The final trial is complete. Luminary Mohg is sure to welcome you into his service, as a knight who will lay the foundations for his dynasty.
usage: Fully reddened oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood.
location: Obtained after soaking the white cloth with a maiden's blood

name: Weathered Dagger
description: Dagger received from Fia, the Deathbed Companion. She wishes for it to be returned to its rightful owner. It was once a special weapon of gold and silver intertwined, but is now worn down and marred by a black gash.
usage: Dagger received from Fia, Deathbed Companion
location: Roundtable Hold Obtained from Fia after reaching Altus Plateau.

name: Black Knifeprint
description: On the Night of the Black Knives, someone stole a fragment of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade, and imbued its power into the assassins' daggers. This mark is evidence of the ritual, and hides the truth of the conspiracy.
usage: Mark of the Night of the Black Knives ritual
location: Drops from Black Knife Assassin in Black Knife Catacombs[Map Link]

name: Cursemark of Death
description: Cursemark carved into the discarded flesh of Ranni the Witch. Also known as the half-wheel wound of the centipede. This cursemark was carved at the moment of Death of the first demigod, and should have taken the shape of a circle. However, two demigods perished at the same time, breaking the cursemark into two half-wheels. Ranni was the first of the demigods whose flesh perished, while the Prince of Death perished in soul alone.
usage: Cursemark carved into Lunar Princess Ranni's discarded flesh.
location: Found on a body lying at the top of the Divine Tower of Liurnia[Map Link]

name: Seedbed Curse
description: Curse grown on a corpse killed and defiled by the Dung Eater. A tender pox afflicted with omen horns.  The Dung Eater cultivates the seedbed curse on corpses. By doing so he prevents dead souls returning to the Erdtree, leaving them forever cursed. One of the most loathsome things found in the Lands Between.
usage: Curse grown on a body defiled by the Dung Eater.
location: See Seedbed Curse for a full list of locations

name: Sellen's Primal Glintstone
description: Glintstone from within the sorceress Sellen's body.Seemingly half-alive, blood vessels are visible within.In essence, a primal glintstone is a sorcerer's soul.If transplanted into a compatible new body after their original body dies, the sorcerer will rise again."My apprentice, do you think it distasteful?"
usage: Glintstone from within Sellen's body.
location: Found beneath Witchbane Ruins

name: Seluvis's Potion
description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a cloudy tonic of bluish black. "Find Nepheli, and ensure she drinks it."
usage: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis
location: Acquired from Seluvis at Seluvis's Rise after being asked by Ranni the Witch to speak with him[Map Link]

name: Seluvis's Introduction
description: Scroll bearing a royal coat of arms. A letter of introduction written by Preceptor Seluvis. Addressed to a glintstone sorceress by the name of Sellen. The contents of the scroll cannot be discerned.
usage: Letter of introduction addressed to Sellen
location: Seluvis's Rise, Liurnia Given by Preceptor Seluvis

name: Amber Starlight
description: An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale amber glow. What remains of a passing flash of starlight. If the stars command our fates, then amber-hued stars must command the fates of the gods. Such is the belief that inspired the use of these shards to prepare a most special draught. Cannot be consumed by mere humans.
usage: Used in the preparation of a peculiar drought.
location: Altus Plateau Found through a cave north-east of the Altus Highway Junction Site of Grace[Map Link]

name: Amber Draught
description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a gleaming amber draught for use in a scheme. "Give it to Ranni and ensure she drinks it. And we'll be in a position to claim the very finest puppet ever crafted."
usage: Given by Preceptor Seluvis during his questline, when choosing to betray Ranni the Witch.
location: Received from Preceptor Seluvis after handing over the Amber Starlight

name: Fingerslayer Blade
description: The hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron; a blade said to have been born of a corpse. This blood-drenched fetish is proof of the high treason committed by the Eternal City and symbolizes its downfall. Cannot be wielded by those without a fate, but is said to be able to harm the Greater Will and its vassals.
usage: Hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron.
location: Found in a chest under the massive skeleton statue in Night's Sacred Ground[Map Link]

name: Miniature Ranni
description: A doll resembling Ranni the Witch. From head to toe every detail is perfect. This unresponsive doll seems pleasantly cool. A doll resembling Ranni the Witch. From head to toe every detail is perfect. The chilliness is gone, feeling now like an empty husk. There is no response. Ach, this form hath loosened my tongue. I've let slip too much. Forget what thou'st heard. Forget.
usage: Doll resembling Ranni the Witch.
location: Found in an open stone coffin in the waters of Ainsel River Main[Map Link]

name: Dark Moon Ring
description: Ring depicting a leaden full moon. Symbolic of a cold oath, the ring is supposed to be given by Lunar Princess Ranni to her consort. Ranni is an Empyrean, meaning her consort would by rights earn the title of lord. A warning is engraved within; "Whoever thou mayest be, take not the ring from this place, the solitude beyond the night is better mine alone."
usage: Ring of Lunar Princess Ranni's cold oath.
location: Found in a locked chest next to the Raya Lucaria Grand Library Site of Grace - unlocked using the Discarded Palace Key[Map Link]

name: Deathroot
description: A source that gives rise to Those Who Live in Death. The beast clergyman, found at Bestial Sanctum in the distant east, collects and devours these roots. On the night of the dire plot the stolen Rune of Death enabled the first Death of a demigod. Later, the Rune of Death spread across the Lands Between through the underground roots of the Greattree, sprouting in the form of Deathroot.
usage: Beast Clergyman seeks and devours these.
location: See Deathroot for a full list of locations

name: Beast Eye
description: Claw-marked stone eye received from Gurranq, Beast Clergyman. It is said to tremble when near Deathroot. The murky violet iris writhes as if alive.  "I am not sated... Feed me more...Death..."
usage: Said to tremble when close to Deathroot.
location: Gurranq, Beast Clergyman rewards the player for bringing Deathroot

name: Dragon Heart
description: Dragon heart seized by a dragon tracker. Riddled with Gravel Stone, this grotesque organ continues to beat vivaciously. An offering used in the Dragon Communion. Consume a dragon's heart at the altar to make its power yours. While a terrible and savage-looking thing, the heart has a peculiar beauty to it.
usage: Gain power of the dragon at the Dragon Communion altar.
location: See Dragon Heart for an extensive list of item locations.

name: Lost Ashes of War
description: Empty ashes of war, devoid of any memories of battle. Unable to apply any kind of affinity in their current state, but can be used by Smithing Master Hewg of the Roundtable Hold to recreate other ashes. Thus does the copy pass into becoming the genuine article.
usage: Used to duplicate Ashes of War.
location: See Lost Ashes of War for a full list of locations

name: Celestial Dew
description: A hidden Tear found in the Eternal City. Also known as a Night Tear. Allows one to carry out an Absolution at the Church of Vows, reversing all antagonizations. Once upon a time, the stars of the night sky guided fate, and this is a recollection of those times.
usage: Carry out Absolution at the Church of Vows.
location: See Celestial Dew for a full list of locations

name: Larval Tear
description: An exceptionally rare creature that burgeons from spiritgraves and lives only a fleeting existence.Neither flesh nor spirit, but something in between. Material required by the amber egg cradled by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to birth people anew. Being born anew allows the reallocation of attributes boosted by leveling up. An exceptionally rare creature that burgeons from spiritgraves and lives only a fleeting existence. Neither flesh nor spirit, but something in between. Material required by the amber egg cradled by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to birth people anew. Being born anew allows the reallocation of attributes boosted by leveling up.
usage: Material needed by Rennala to grant rebirth.
location: See Larval Tear for a full list of locations

name: Crafting Kit
description: Leather bag containing a pestle and mortar, small blade, and various other tools. Enables item crafting from the main menu. Provides both means to fight and means to survive.
usage: Enables item crafting from the main menu.
location: Church of Elleh, Limgrave Can be purchased from Merchant Kalé for  300 Runes[Map Link]

name: Spirit Calling Bell
description: A bell capable of summoning various spirits from ashen remains. It usually requires FP to use. Spirits can only be summoned in the vicinity of a rebirth monument. When summoning is possible, the monument icon will be visible on the left side of the screen. Only one type of spirit may be summoned at once, and none may be summoned during multiplayer.
usage: Bell that summons various spirits from ashen items
location: Church of Elleh, Limgrave Received from Renna after obtaining the Spectral Steed Whistle

name: Whetstone Knife
description: Whetstone with a cipher inscription, made to look like a small knifeblade. Allows the use of ashes of war at a site of grace to bestow new battle arts and affinities to armaments as skills. The battle arts and affinities will depend on the ashes of war used.
usage: Can add new battle arts and affinities to weapons
location: Gatefront Ruins, Limgrave A set of stairs leads to a room with a chest containing it and the Ash of War: Storm Stomp[Map Link]

name: Cross Map
description: A simple map drafted by a hornsent. Marked with the locations of golden crosses. These crosses indicate Miquella's footprints.
usage: Map marked with the locations of golden crosses
location: Given by Hornsent when first interacted with. Speak to Hornsent when you first meet him and exhaust his dialogue lines to obtain the item. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: New Cross Map
description: A simple map drafted by a hornsent. Recently revised. Reveals the locations of newly-discovered golden crosses. The crosses are akin to Miquella's footprints. Or gravestones, which mark what he has left behind.
usage: Map showing new locations of golden crosses
location: Meet Hornsent in the Highroad Cross Site of Grace, to receive this new map. You must pass through Castle Ensis right after defeating Rellana, Twin Moon Knight. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Ruins Map
description: A simple old map, faded and dirty. Acquired from Count Ymir, High Priest. Indicates the location of a hallowed ruin. "I only wish to be of service."
usage: Map indicating the location of a hallowed ruin
location: Given by Count Ymir when first met at the Cathedral of Manus Metyr. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Ruins Map (2nd)
description: A simple old map, faded and dirty. Acquired from Count Ymir, High Priest. Indicates another hallowed ruin, apart from the one shown on the first map. "May the gleaming stars guide you evermore."
usage: Map indicating the location of a hallowed ruin
location: Given by Count Ymir.

name: Ruins Map (3rd)
description: A simple old map, faded and dirty. Acquired from Count Ymir, High Priest. Indicates a third and final hallowed ruin, distinct from those shown on the first two maps. "May you join the glimmering stars above."
usage: Map indicating the location of a hallowed ruin
location: Given by Count Ymir.

name: Map: Gravesite Plain
description: Map of the Gravesite Plain. A somber plain covered in spiritgraves. The spiral tower of the hornsent lies to the northwest, and the entire expanse is marred by the harrowing ravages of war.
usage: Map of Gravesite Plain
location: To find this Map Fragment, travel directly northeast from when you first entered the Shadow Realm. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Map: Scadu Altus
description: Map of Scadu Altus. The plateau occupied by Messmer's army that peers towards the Scadutree to the northeast, named after its counterpart in the realm of the Erdtree. At its center lies the shadow keep.
usage: Map of Scadu Altus
location: It can be found if you continue the path forward past the Highroad Cross Site of Grace, you will eventually run into it. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Map: Southern Shore
description: Map of the southern shore of the Gravesite Plain. A captivating vista of brilliant blue flowers, intermingled with colossal stone coffins of unknown origin that seemingly drifted to this place. To the east, the jagged peak thrusts upward into the clouds.
usage: Map of the southern shore of Gravesite Plain
location: South of the Cerulean Coast Site of Grace past the ghost flame dragon, at a bend in the road. [See Shadow of the Erdtree Map]

name: Map: Rauh Ruins
description: Map of the ancient Rauh Ruins. These giant ruins are flooded, overgrown, and split into two by a chasm. To the southwest is the Church of the Bud, overlooking the tower of shadow.
usage: Map of the Rauh Ruins
location: Can be looted by the foot of a monolith. To reach this location, make your way into the Scadu Atlus region. Starting from the Moorth Ruins Site of Grace located in Scadu Atlus, head northeast towards the hidden cave and follow the tunnel leading to the Ancient Ruins Base. Next, follow the canyon along and you'll find it just outside the Temple Town Ruins. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Map: Abyss
description: Map of the abyss at the east of the Gravesite Plain. A thick forest sprawls at the depths of the ravine that is untouched even by sunlight. Known as the sanctum of Sage Midra, and is a region forbidden by the hornsent.
usage: Map of the Abyss to the east of Gravesite Plain
location: Map of the Abbys at the east of the Gravesite Plain. Found besides a column. [Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree Interactive Map]

name: Sewing Needle
description: A large sewing needle, curved like a fang.Boc the demi-human's prized possession.
usage: A large sewing needle, curved like a fang. Boc the demi-human's prized possession.
location: Coastal Cave, Limgrave Dropped by Demi-Human Chief

name: Gold Sewing Needle
description: Sewing needle made of gold. Unique item made to alter demigod attire.  One of the tools brought by Radagon when he entered into marriage with Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, and joined the Carian line.
usage: Special sewing needle for demigod attire.
location: Church of Vows, Liurnia Found in a chest

name: Tailoring Tools
description: A portable set of tailoring tools. Enables armor alterations at sites of grace.
usage: Enables armor adjustment at sites of grace.
location: Coastal Cave, Limgrave Dropped by Demi-Human Chief

name: Golden Tailoring Tools
description: Tailoring tools made from gold. Tools brought with the red-haired Radagon when he married into the Carian line. With these, even demigod attire can be altered at a site of grace.
usage: Allows demigod garb alteration at sites of grace.
location: Church of Vows, Liurnia Found in a chest

name: Map: Limgrave, West
description: Map of the western region of Limgrave.  The demesne of Limgrave, far south of the Erdtree, is bordered to the northwest by the cliffs of Stormveil, and under its ever-clouded skies roll the great steppes of the pale lands.
usage: Map of Limgrave's western region.
location: Looted from a pillar in Gatefront Ruins, just south from Stormgate[Map Link]

name: Map: Limgrave, East
description: Map of the eastern region of Limgrave. Other than the Mistwood which envelops the south, it is known for its lands which lead to Caelid, a path trod by many a soldier in the past.
usage: Map of Limgrave's eastern region.
location: Can be found North-East of Mistwood Ruins, in front of a pillar containing what appears to be ancient writings[Map Link]

name: Map: Weeping Peninsula
description: Map of the Weeping Peninsula. The peninsula, to Limgrave's south, is named for its unceasing rainfall, redolent of lament.
usage: Map of Weeping peninsula.
location: The map for Weeping Peninsula is found by following the main road south from the Bridge of Sacrifice, past the Castle Morne Rampart site of Grace[Map Link]

name: Map: Liurnia, West
description: Map of Liurnia's western region. The majority of Liurnia, known for its vast forests and ever-present fog, is sinking into a lake. The western coast has always been closely associated with Carian royalty.
usage: Map of Liurnia's western region.
location: On a monolith in the open field northeast of the North Liurnia Lake Shore Site of Grace in northern Liurnia[Map Link]

name: Map: Liurnia, East
description: Map of Liurnia's eastern region. The majority of Liurnia, known for its vast forests and ever-present fog, is sinking into a lake. The eastern coast is home to a highroad running north and south.
usage: Map of Liurnia's eastern region.
location: Found in the south of the swampy lake, in the middle by a monument with enlightened texts on it, in Liurnia[Map Link]

name: Map: Liurnia, North
description: Map of Liurnia's northern region. The Academy of Raya Lucaria towers over the north, while at its base spreads the town built around it, now flooded. Two highroads end their journeys here.
usage: Map of Liurnia's northern region.
location: You can find the Liurnia North Map at the South Entrance to the Academy Gate Town, by the flooded roads leading to the Academy of Raya Lucaria

name: Map: Altus Plateau
description: Map of Altus Plateau and environs. The Altus Plateau, where the Erdtree's base can be found, contains the Royal Capital of Leyndell to the east, and Mt. Gelmir to the west. Scars from the Shattering remain apparent to this day.
usage: Map of Altus Plateau and environs.
location: North of the Altus Highway Junction site of grace[Map Link]

name: Map: Leyndell, Royal Capital
description: Map of the Royal Capital of Leyndell and environs. Leyndell, City of the Erdtree, is a metropolis enclosed by double ramparts. The inner wall remains unbreached to this day.
usage: Map of Leyndell Capital and environs.
location: Capital Outskirts: Found under a monolith near the Outer Wall Phantom Tree Site of Grace[Map Link]

name: Map: Mt. Gelmir
description: Map of Mt. Gelmir and environs.  Mt. Gelmir, which houses the Volcano Manor at its summit, is characterized by sheer cliffs and ominous skies. These qualities only became more pronounced after the Shattering.
usage: Map of Mt. Gelmir and environs.
location: Found on a pillar in front of the Road of Iniquity Site of Grace[Map Link]

name: Map: Caelid
description: Map of Caelid and environs. Caelid, known as the locale of the last battle between General Radahn and Malenia, Blade of Miquella, is a vast land consummately marred by scarlet rot.
usage: Map of Caelid and environs.
location: On a monolith near the middle of Caelid Highway South. Directly southeast of the Caelid Highway South Sites of Grace[Map Link]

name: Map: Dragonbarrow
description: Map of Dragonbarrow and environs. The dragons that escaped the scarlet rot and made nest of the plateau to Caelid's north. Thus it was named "Dragonbarrow," and none dare to enter.
usage: Map of Dragonbarrow and environs.
location: Found on a monolith directly east of the Dragonbarrow West Site of Grace, along the road[Map Link]

name: Map: Mountaintops of The Giants, West
description: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants. Marching ground during the War against the Giants. They carved winding paths in the cliff walls right up to the summit, leading to the untrodden snow-laden region beyond.
usage: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants.
location: Go up the Grand Lift of Rold from Leyndell, along the path

name: Map: Mountaintops of The Giants, East
description: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants. The remote, desolate eastern summit is the highest point in all the Lands Between, overlooking even the Flame Peak to the south.
usage: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants.
location: Mountaintops of the Giants: Found at the altar. You can arrive by walking on the chain from the enemy encampment [Map Link]

name: Map: Consecrated Snowfield
description: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs. The route through this land, crossed east to west by a frozen river, leads to Miquella's Haligtree. This is the path taken by those unchosen, though it is a trial all the same.
usage: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs.
location: Map for all of Consecrated Snowfield: find it by following the road north past the snowstorm until you go down and cross a frozen river, then you will spot the map pillar ahead[Map Link]

name: Map: Ainsel River
description: Map of Ainsel River and environs Two great rivers flow beneath the Lands Between, the Siofra and the Ainsel. The vast region is said to be the grave of civilizations that flourished before the Erdtree.
usage: Map of Ainsel River and environs.
location: Found inside a ruin next to the Nomadic Merchant in Ainsel River[Map Link]

name: Map: Lake of Rot
description: Map of Lake of Rot and environs. A great lake of standing water downstream of the Ainsel River. It is said that the divine essence of an outer god is sealed away in this land.
usage: Map of Lake of Rot and environs.
location: Found on a corpse by the water's edge at Lake of Rot, by the Lake Rot Shoreside Site of Grace[Map Link]

name: Map: Siofra River
description: Map of Siofra River and environs Two great rivers flow beneath the Lands Between, the Siofra and the Ainsel. This vast region is said to be the grave of civilizations that flourished before the Erdtree.
usage: Map of Siofra River and environs.
location: Found next to the staircase leading up to Hallowhorn Grounds[Map Link]

name: Map: Mohgwyn Palace
description: Map of Mohgwyn Palace and environs. In the lightless depths lies the grave of an ancient civilization. It is here Mohg, the Lord of Blood, is building his palace, to be the seat of his coming dynasty named Mohgwyn. And whatever nightmares that may bring.
usage: Map of Mohgwyn Palace and environs.
location: Found soon after accessing the staircase to Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum, in the underground of Mohgwyn Palace - found just past a group of blood Albinaurics that summon giant skeletons[Map Link]

name: Map: Deeproot Depths
description: Map of Deeproot Depths and environs. At the very depths of the Erdtree's majestic roots lies the source of the Ainsel and the Siofra rivers. Here too begins the network of Greattree roots that spread throughout the Lands Between.
usage: Map of Deeproot Depths and environs.
location: Can be found on a corpse in a gazebo amid the destroyed ruins[Map Link]

name: Academy Scroll
description: Scroll of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, the glintstone sorcerers' place of study. Can be given to a learn sorcerer to gain access to the following sorceries: - Great Glintstone Shard- Swift Glintstone Shard
usage: Give to a learned sorcerer to unlock Great Glintstone Shard and Swift Glintstone Shard for purchase.
location: Liurnia Found in a graveyard, west of the Lake-Facing Cliff site of grace[Map Link]

name: Conspectus Scroll
description: A sorcery scroll from the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Details superior sorceries taught to scholars worthy of donning the stone crown and studying a certain conspectus.  Can be given to a learned sorcerer to gain access to the following sorceries:  - Glintstone Cometshard - Star Shower
usage: Give to a learned sorcerer to unlock Glintstone Cometshard and Star Shower for purchase.
location: Great Hall, Raya Lucaria Academy From the doorway, go left and you'll find a room, there is a body that you can loot to find the scroll[Map Link]

name: Royal House Scroll
description: Sorcery scroll of the Carian royal family, the heads of the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Can be given to a learned sorcerer to gain access to the following sorceries: -Glintblade Phalanx-Carian Slicer
usage: Give to a learned sorcerer to unlock Glintblade Phalanx and Carian Slicer for purchase.
location: Head southeast from the Agheel Lake South site of grace, head to the top of a cliff and you'll see a statue of an object that looks like the half piece of a bowl or a circle. Face the other way, to see a Knight. Keep going to a structure to see a man standing watching over the big structure, alongside a dead body. In that body, you will find the Royal House Scroll. [Map Link]

name: Two Fingers Prayerbook
description: Prayerbook containing incantations of the Two Fingers.An item once entrusted to Tarnished worthy of lordship. Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations: - Lord's Heal - Lord's Aid
usage: Give to a learned cleric to unlock Lord's Heal and Lord's Aid for purchase.
location: Located nearby a fireplace in the Fortified Manor in Leyndell, Royal Capital

name: Assassin's Prayerbook
description: Prayerbook of the Roundtable Hold's assassins. Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations: - Assassin's Approach - Darkness
usage: Give to a learned cleric to unlock Assassin's Approach and Darkness for purchase.
location: Can be found behind the second Imp Statue door in Roundtable Hold, the first door will require one Key to open, and the second door behind the first requires two keys to open. So you will need three keys total to unlock this.

name: Golden Order Principia
description: Prayerbook of the Golden Order fundamentalists. A dense and complex academic treatise that contains the Order's fundamental principles. Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations: Radagon's Rings of Light Law of Regression
usage: Give to a learned cleric to unlock Radagon's Rings of Light and Law of Regression for purchase.
location: Located in a chair hanging from the ceiling directly above the[Erdtree Sanctuary site in Leyndell, Royal Capital. ([Map Link]) From the Erdtree Sanctuary site in Leyndell, Royal Capital, exit the east side of the room. Once outside, climb up the root to the left that circles back into the building's 2nd floor. Once inside, exit the only door and immediately turn left to jump down to a nearby roof. Once on the roof, a broken window can be used to get back inside. After entering the broken window, climb the root crossing the room to reach the Golden Order Principia, which is located in the chair hanging from the ceiling.

name: Dragon Cult Prayerbook
description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A text of the knights' faith that arose after the War of the Ancient Dragons. Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations: - Lightning Spear- Honed Bolt- Electrify Armament
usage: Give to a learned cleric to unlock Lightning Spear, Honed Bolt, and Electrify Armament for purchase.
location: Dropped by a knight patrolling immediately south of the Liurnia Artist's Shack[Map Link]

name: Ancient Dragon Prayerbook
description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A lost tome that never reached the Lands Between. Contains red lightning incantations. Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following  incantations: - Ancient Dragons' Lightning Spear - Ancient Dragons' Lightning Strike
usage: Give to a learned cleric to unlock Ancient Dragons' Lightning Spear and Ancient Dragons' Lightning Strike for purchase.
location: In the middle of the main hall after finding the Crumbling Beast Grave Depths Farum Azula Site of Grace, in Crumbling Farum Azula[Map Link]

name: Fire Monks' Prayerbook
description: Prayerbook of the Fire Monks, who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants far to the north. Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations: - O, Flame! - Surge, O Flame!
usage: Give to a learned cleric to unlock O, Flame! and Surge, O Flame! for purchase.
location: Liurnia: Found on a corpse in a Fire Monk outpost in the southern landmass[Map Link]

name: Giant's Prayerbook
description: Prayerbook that contains the secrets of the Fire Giants. Kept hidden by the prelates who monitor the Giant's Flame. Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations: - Giantsflame Take Thee- Flame, Fall Upon Them
usage: Give to a learned cleric to unlock Giantsflame Take Thee and Flame, Fall Upon Them for purchase.
location: Inside a chest at the very top of Guardian's Garrison in Mountaintops of the Giants. It's in a tower behind NPC mini-boss Chief Guardian Arghanthy, up a ladder. [Map Link]

name: Godskin Prayerbook
description: Prayerbook bound in supple skin.Incantations of the god-slaying black flame are written within. Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations: - Black Flame- Black Flame Blade
usage: Give to a learned cleric to unlock Black Flame and Black Flame Blade for purchase.
location: Stormveil Castle. From the Rampart Tower site of grace, head outside. Take a running jump onto the roof across. From the roof, drop down to the grassy courtyard. Descend down the nearby stairs and follow its path until you find a fog wall. Use a Stonesword Key to pass through it and the prayerbook will be in one of the two chests inside the room. [Map Link]
